Title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
Author: Ted Elliott
Terry Rossio

Replies.Reply: I think it's bad luck for the groom to see the bride before the wedding.
Jack's Compass. What does Beckett want with that?
No! Will has gone to find Jack!
A fair trial for Will ends in a hanging.
I expect then that we can come to some sort of understanding. I'm here to negotiate.
These Letters of Marque, they are signed by the King?
I have been to Isla de Muerta, I have seen the treasure myself. There is something you need to know.
Consider into your calculations that you robbed me of my wedding night.
James Norrington.  What has the world done to you?
I'm here to find the man I love.
Jack. I know Will came to find you. Where is he?
Jack. All I want is to find Will.
And you have a way of doing that?
Oh Jack! Are you telling the truth?
Yes, they're signed, Lord Cutler Beckett of the East India Trading Company.
Yes, he did say something about a chest.
Jack, the Letters, give them back.
I don't know what you mean.
Oh, don't be absurd. I trust him, that's all.
Oh. Except for a sense of honor, and decency and-and a moral center. And personal hygiene.
will come a moment when you have a chance to show it. To do the right thing.
You'll have the chance to do something...
I have faith in you. Want to know why?
Curiosity. You're going to want it. A chance to be admired. And gain the rewards that follow. You won't be able to resist. You're going to want to know...
doesn't show you what you want most.
Will! You're alright! Thank God! I came to find you!
Everything you said to me... every word, was a lie!
We're not getting out of this.
Norrington took it to draw them off.
He's right, we have to head for land.
You came back. I always knew you were a good man.
It's after you, not the ship. It's not us. This is the only way, don't you see? I'm not sorry.
He elected to stay behind to give us a chance.
I don't know. You look beautiful.
More acquaintance than friend. How do you know him?
Recover. At the point of a sword?
Somehow I doubt Jack will consider employment the same as being free.
The property you want that he possesses.
Does it matter? I'm to find Jack and convince him to return to Port Royal. In exchange the charges against us will be dropped.
Is that lack of faith in Jack, or in me?
Eagerly, if you'll still have me.
Keep a weather eye on the horizon.
What's wrong? The beach is right there.
Euh! Unh! Ya! Come on! Let's go! Euh! Ya! Come on! Who wants it? Unh! I could do this all day! Euh! Euh! Hah!
Jack? Jack Sparrow! I can honestly say I'm glad to see you!
Why would he do this to us? If Jack is their chief.
So he had no choice. He's a captive then as much as the rest of us.
Where's the rest of the crew?
Well, we can't just sit here and wait then, can we?
Cut it loose! Find a rock!
What about Jack? I won't leave without him.
I need that Compass of yours, Jack. I must trade it for her freedom.
What we need to do is make sail for Port Royal with all haste.
You want me to find this?
This... is going to save Elizabeth?
Why is Jack afraid of the open ocean?
And the key will spare him that?
What... exactly did he put into the chest?
It seems... we have a need to find the Flying Dutchman.
That's the Flying Dutchman? She doesn't look like much.
I cut down anyone in my path.
There's no use. You've run aground.
Jack Sparrow sent me to settle his debt.
Jack Sparrow. He sent me to settle his debt.
Not until I find this. The key.
What do you know of this?
So the captain has the key.
It's a game of deception. Your bet includes all the dice, not just your own.
So any crewman can be challenged?
My soul. An eternity of servitude.
That's not part of the game, is it? You can still walk away.
Fool. Why did you do that?
It was never about winning, or losing.
It's not a fate you had to choose for yourself, either.
I take this with a promise. I'll find a way to sever Jones' hold on you. And not rest until this blade pierces his heart. I will not abandon you. I promise.
Just put as many leagues behind us as you can. As fast as you can.
That dress. Where did you get it?
I imagine... some of your crew may have jumped ship there.
I've doomed us all.  It's the Flying Dutchman!
Sea turtles, mate. A pair of them, strapped to my feet.
But I do owe you thanks, Jack.
After you tricked me onto that ship to square your debt with Jones.
I was reunited with my father.
I keep the promises I make, Jack. I intend to free my father. I hope you're here to see it.
No. It's not a reef! Get away from the rail!
It'll be back. We have to get off the ship.
Pull the grates! Get all the gunpowder onto the net in the cargo hold.
Euh! Come on!I'm over here! Come on!
We have to try. We can get away as it takes down the Pearl.
Doesn't matter now. The Pearl's gone. Along with its captain.
If there was anything could be done to bring him back...  Elizabeth...
Governor Weatherby Swann, it's been too long.
warrant for the arrest of one William Turner.
Oh, is it? That's annoying. My mistake. Arrest her.
Ah-ha! Here's the one for William Turner. And I have another one for a Mister James Norrington. Is he present?
I don't believe that's the answer to the question I asked.
a certain pirate named Jack Sparrow.
Captain Jack Sparrow. Yes, I thought you might.
The East India Trading Company has need of your services.  We wish for you to act as our agent in a business transaction with our mutual friend: Captain Sparrow.
By your efforts Jack Sparrow was set free. I would like you to go to him, and recover a certain property in his possession.
Letters of Marque. You will offer what amounts to a full pardon. Jack will be free, a privateer in the employ of England.

A ship? Hardly. The item in question's considerably smaller and far more valuable. Something Sparrow keeps on his person at all times. A compass.  Ah, you know it. Bring back that Compass, or there's no deal.
No doubt you've discovered that loyalty is no longer the currency of the realm, as your father believes.
Yes, and they're not valid until they bear my signature and my seal.
Oh really. To ensure Mister Turner's freedom, then? I'll still want that Compass. Consider that in your calculations.
There's something to knowing the exact shape of the world and one's place in it, don't you agree?
I had you brought here because I thought you'd be interested in the whereabouts of your daughter.
Your authority as governor, your influence in London, and your loyalty to the East India Trading Company.
So you see, Mercer, every man has a price he will willingly accept. Even for what he hopes never to sell.
Is there any news on the chest?
If you intend to claim these, then you must have something to trade. D'you have the Compass?
You got what you went in for, then?
All in all, it's seems some time since we did a speck of honest pirating.
there's something valuable. So, we're setting out to find whatever this key unlocks!
So - We're going after this key!
Settin' sail without knowing his own headin'? Somethin's got Jack vexed. Mark my words, what bodes ill for Jack Sparrow bodes ill for us all.
Back to your stations! The lot o' ya!
form, and they intend to do him the honor of releasing him from his fleshy prison.

Put your legs through, start to climb! Agh!
Come on, men! Lift it like a lady's skirt!
Let's put some distance between us and this island, and head out to open sea.

Well, if you believe such things, there's a beast does the bidding of Davy Jones. A fearsome creature with giant tentacles that suction your face clean off. And drag an entire ship past the crushing darkness. The Kraken!
Now that's the very question Jack wants answered. Bad enough even to go visit...
Must've run afoul of the reef.
And how do you intend to harvest these ninety-nine souls in three days?
And what makes you think you're worthy to crew the Black Pearl?
You'll do. Make your mark. Next!
It's the crow's nest for you.
Sooner than you think. Sign the roster.
Including those four? That gives us - four!
Lord. You didn't try to sail through it?
Finally! Cast off those lines, weigh anchor, and prow that canvas!
Will was working for Beckett, and never said a word.
Beckett wants the Compass. Only one reason for that.
If the company controls the chest, they controls the sea.
And bad. Bad for every mother's son what calls himself a pirate. I think there's a bit more speed to be coaxed from these sails. Brace the foreyard!
My prayers be with him. Best not wallow in our grief. The bright side is: You're back. And made it off free and clear.
There's only half a dozen kegs of powder!
Heave! Heave like you're being paid for it!
No. We just made it angry. We're not out of this yet. Captain! Orders!
Abandon ship. Abandon ship or abandon hope.
Prepare to cast off! There's no time to lose! Come on, Will, step to!
Aye. And already the world seems a bit less bright. He fooled us all right to the end. But I guess that honest streak finally won out. To Jack Sparrow!
Mind if we make a little side trip? I didn't think so.
Is that how you're all feeling, then? Perhaps dear old Jack is not serving your best interests as captain?

No! If we don't have the key, we can't open whatever it is we don't have that it unlocks. So what purpose would be served in finding whatever need be unlocked, which we don't have, without first having found the key what unlocks it?
You're not making any sense at all. Any more questions?
Hah! A heading. Set sail in a... mmm...

you shall always remember as the day that you almost -

We have a need to travel upriver.

There'll be no knowing here. We've come for help and we're not leaving without it.
We're looking for this.  And what it goes to.
I did not. I didn't know where the key was. But now we do. So all that's left is to climb aboard the Flying Dutchman, grab the key, you go back to Port Royal and save your bonnie lass, hey!
Dirt. This is a jar of dirt.
Is the... jar of dirt going to help?
I like it. Simple, easy to remember.
just say Jack Sparrow sent you to settle his debt! Might save your life!

least four... maybe three and a half. And did I happen to mention... he's in love. With a girl. Due to be married. Betrothed.  Dividing him from her and her from him... would only be half as cruel as actually allowing them be joined in holy matrimony. Aye?

of circumstances that have nothing whatsoever to do with me, poor William has been press-ganged into Davy Jones' crew.

ship, I could in fact perform a... marriage. Right here. Right on this deck. Right...
and I. I and you. Us.

One word love: curiosity. You long for freedom. You long to do what you want to do because you want it. To act on selfish impulse. You want to see what it's like. One day, you won't be able to resist.
at them as they pass by.

I do that quite a lot. Yet people are always surprised.

I knew you'd warm up to me eventually.
Ah. The dark side of ambition.
that you've ended up a rum-pot deckhand what takes orders from pirates?

Uh, I say we respect his final wish.
Hey! Fishface! Lose something? Hey? Oup!

The last of our ships has returned.

Well I say it was divine providence what escaped us from jail.

Well, how'd you get it back last time?
We done it for you! Knowin' you'd be comin' back for us.

What contains the still-beating heart o' Davy Jones.
Welcome to the crew, former Commodore! Heh-heh-heh-heh-heh-heh-heh-heh...
Well we ain't original Scandinavians, are we? Kray-ken!
I think we've held fire long enough.
He was a gentleman of fortune, he was.

Enough! Enough! You're a pair of superstitious goats and it's got the best of you. Now this appears to be no more as we have a stowaway aboard. A young woman, by the look of it. I want you to search the ship and find 'er. Oh, and uh...
I'm sorry. An honest sailor is what I am. I make my living fair, and I sleep well each night, thank you.
And what are we running from?
It was found aboard the ship. The crew it thought it was a spirit bringing some omen of ill fate.
It brought good fortune! The spirit told us... Put in at Tortuga. And we made a nice bit of profit there.
Oh, Mother Cary's chickens. What happened?   ?QUARTERMASTER Must've hit a reef.

The... female presence... amongst us, yes... all the men... they can feel it.  The ghost of a lady, widowed before her marriage, I figure it. Searching for her husband, lost at sea.  A virgin, too, likely as not.
I'm afraid, Sir... Tortuga is the only free port left in these waters.
Look there! There it is. There's the sign.
Not so well as I had hoped. Come.
What... service... may I do you? Hmmm? You know I demand payment.
You know of... Davy Jones, yes? A man of de sea. A great sailor, until he ran afoul of dat which vex all men.
as changing, and harsh, and untamable as the sea. Him never stopped loving her. But the pain it cause 'im was too much to live wid. But not enough to cause him to die.
It was not wort' feeling what... small fleeting joy life brings, and so...
Davy Jones cannot make port. Cannot step on land but once every ten years. Land is where you are safe, Jack Sparrow. And so you will carry land wid you...
If you don' want it, give it back.
Against de cold... and de sorrow.
It's a shame. I know you're t'inking that wid the Pearl, you coulda captured the devil and set free your fadder's soul.
The boy's not here. He must've been claimed by the sea.
Then trust us to act in your stead.
Turns out not even Jack Sparrow can best the devil.
Do you fear death?  Do you fear that dark abyss? All your deeds laid bare. All your sins punished.  I can offer you... an escape-uh.
Join my crew, and postpone the judgment. One hundred years before the mast. Will ye serve?
One soul is not equal to another.
I keep the boy. Ninety-nine souls-uh. But I wonder, Sparrow, can you live with this? Can you condemn an innocent man - a friend-uh - to a lifetime of servitude, in your name while you roam free?
Will you now? And what would prompt such an act of charity?
Ha ha ha ha! Ha ha! What fortuitous circumstance be this! Five lashes be owed. I believe it is.
How do you know of the key?
And be called a liar myself for my trouble? Bootstrap Bill, you're a liar and you will spend an eternity on this ship! Master Turner, feel free to go ashore...
You need time alone with your thoughts.
Who sent that thieving charlatan onto my ship? Who told them of the key? Jack Sparrow.
Send his beloved Pearl back to the depths!
Let them taste the triple guns.
Open the chest. Open the chest, I need to see it!
Truth be told, I never sailed a day in me life. I figure I should get out and see the world while I'm still young.
My wife ran off with my dog. And I'm drunk for a month. And I don't give a ass rat's if I live or die.
Ever since I was a little lad, I've always wanted to sail the seas. Forever.
Or should I just kill you now?
Sorry. Old habits and all that.
Come on, men! Who wants some? Form an orderly line, I'll have you all one by one. Come on, who's first?
Oh, please. The captain of the Flying Dutchman.
You don't actually believe him, do you?
"Unique" here having the meaning of broken.

I can't let you do that, either. So sorry.
Lord Beckett desires the contents of that chest. I deliver it, and get my life back.
Oh, I prefer to see it as the promise of redemption.
Do excuse me while I kill the man who ruined my life.
I took the liberty of filling in my name.
Better.  The heart of Davy Jones.
